elements.text:
Your boss tells everyone that tomorrow you'll divide into small groups to plan out new work projects. She also says that you'll have to pick your group, but you realize you don't have any close friends in your workplace.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I'm excited to work with new people.
I'm nervous about talking about new projects with the my coworkers, but the nerves won't stop me from speaking.
I'm curious if I'll make new friends.
I'm worried that I won't get into a good group.
Right now I’m anxious about not knowing who will be in my group, but this probably won’t feel like such a big deal tomorrow.
